feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Composer
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Composer

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.9
  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.26 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.46
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including updated versions of Airflow 3.1.0, 2.10.5, and 2.9.3. The Airflow 2.10.5 build is the new default.
entry.title: Change: New Airflow builds available

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.16.4-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.16.4-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 are now available, including the latest versions of Composer and Airflow. These updates provide enhanced features and performance improvements for your data processing workflows.
entry.title: Change: New Composer images available

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.15 and composer-2.11.2-*.
entry.summary: Certain versions of Cloud Composer, specifically composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.15 and composer-2.11.2-*, have reached their end of support. Users are advised to migrate to supported versions.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer versions deprecated

entry.content: Environment snapshots are available in environments with Airflow 3 (Preview). This change is now rolled out to all regions supported by Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: You can now save and load environment snapshots in Cloud Composer 3 environments running Airflow 3 (Preview). This feature is available in all supported regions.
entry.title: Feature: Environment snapshots now available

entry.content: (Available without upgrading) Fixed an issue where Airflow workloads used the Performance Persistent Disk type (pd-ssd) instead of the Standard Persistent Disk type (pd-standard).
entry.summary: An issue has been resolved where Airflow workloads were incorrectly using the Performance Persistent Disk type (`pd-ssd`) instead of the intended Standard Persistent Disk type (`pd-standard`). This fix is available without requiring any upgrades.
entry.title: Fixed: Persistent disk type corrected for Airflow workloads

entry.content: (Available without upgrading in Cloud Composer 3) Fixed load snapshot operations that were failing with invalid configuration error for the recently created snapshots.
entry.summary: Fixed load snapshot operations that were failing with invalid configuration errors. This issue affected recently created snapshots and is now resolved without requiring an upgrade in Cloud Composer 3.
entry.title: Fixed: Snapshot operations now fixed

entry.content:
Environment snapshots are available in environments with Airflow 3 (Preview).

This feature is gradually rolled out in several releases and is available in the following regions in this release: africa-south1, asia-east1, asia-east2, asia-northeast2, asia-northeast3, asia-south2, asia-southeast2, australia-southeast2, europe-central2, europe-north1, europe-north2, europe-southwest1, europe-west10, europe-west12, europe-west3, europe-west4, europe-west6, europe-west8, europe-west9, me-central1, me-central2, me-west1, northamerica-northeast1, northamerica-northeast2, northamerica-south1, southamerica-east1, southamerica-west1, us-east1, us-east5, us-south1, us-west2, us-west3 and us-west4.
entry.summary: Save and load environment configurations with snapshots, now in preview for Airflow 3 environments. This feature allows you to easily back up and restore your environment's state. It is currently available in a wide range of global regions.
entry.title: Feature: Environment snapshots now available

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.14 and composer-2.11.1-*.
entry.summary: Certain Cloud Composer versions, including composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.14 and composer-2.11.1-*, are no longer supported. This deprecation follows the standard versioning and support lifecycle. Users are advised to migrate to supported versions to ensure continued functionality and security.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer versions deprecated

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 2) Airflow component metrics are now available on the Monitoring dashboard in the Google Cloud console. This feature was previously available only in Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: You can now view Airflow component metrics directly on the Monitoring dashboard within the Google Cloud console. This enhancement brings a previously Cloud Composer 3-exclusive feature to Cloud Composer 2 users, providing greater visibility into Airflow's performance.
entry.title: Feature: Airflow Component Metrics Now Available

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.8
  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.25 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.45
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including versions 3.1.0, 2.10.5 (default), and 2.9.3. These updates offer the latest features and improvements for your data pipelines.
entry.title: Change: New Airflow builds available

entry.content: (Airflow 3.1.0 in Cloud Composer 3) The apache-airflow-providers-google package was upgraded to version 19.4.0. For more information about changes, see the apache-airflow-providers-google changelog.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now includes Airflow version 3.1.0 with an updated Google provider package (version 19.4.0). Review the provider changelog for detailed information on recent changes.
entry.title: Change: Airflow 3.1.0 available

entry.content: (Available without upgrading) Cloud Composer 3 environment metadata in Cloud Asset Inventory now matches the environment configuration available through the Cloud Composer API, including the image version format.
entry.summary: Environment metadata for Cloud Composer 3 is now available in Cloud Asset Inventory. This metadata aligns with the Cloud Composer API, including the image version format, and is accessible without needing to upgrade.
entry.title: Fixed: Composer 3 metadata now available in Asset Inventory

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.16.3-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.16.3-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images for Composer 2 are now available, including the default version composer-2.16.3-airflow-2.10.5 and an option with airflow-2.9.3. These updates provide the latest features and improvements for your workflows.
entry.title: Change: New Composer Images Available

entry.content: (Airflow 2) The Dag Details view in Airflow UI now scrolls correctly when the "Run config" field contains long values.
entry.summary: The Dag Details view in the Airflow UI now correctly scrolls when the Run config field contains long values. This fix improves usability for users encountering long configuration strings.
entry.title: Fixed: Airflow UI now scrolls correctly

entry.content: The Composer Local Development CLI tool is now available for Airflow 3 (Preview).
entry.summary: The Composer Local Development CLI tool now supports Airflow 3 in preview. This allows developers to test their Airflow environments locally before deploying them. It streamlines the development workflow for Airflow 3 users.
entry.title: Feature: Local Airflow 3 Development Available

entry.content: Database retention policy is now available in environments with Airflow 3, starting with composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.5. This change is now rolled out to all regions supported by Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: A database retention policy is now available for environments with Airflow 3. This feature, starting with composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.5, is rolled out to all supported regions.
entry.title: Feature: Database retention policy now available

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.16.2-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.16.2-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 are now available, including version 2.16.2 with Airflow 2.10.5 as the default. This update provides the latest enhancements and bug fixes for your Composer environments.
entry.title: Change: New Composer Images Available

entry.content:
(Airflow 3.1.0 in Cloud Composer 3) The apache-airflow-providers-google package was upgraded to version 19.2.0.

For more information about changes, see the apache-airflow-providers-google changelog.
entry.summary: The `apache-airflow-providers-google` package has been upgraded to version 19.2.0. This update includes various changes and improvements to the Google provider for Airflow. For detailed information, please refer to the official changelog.
entry.title: Change: Airflow Provider Google Updated

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.12, composer-2.10.2-airflow-2.9.3, composer-2.10.2-airflow-2.10.2.
entry.summary: Several Cloud Composer versions, including composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.12, composer-2.10.2-airflow-2.9.3, and composer-2.10.2-airflow-2.10.2, have reached their end of support period. Users are advised to upgrade to supported versions to ensure continued service availability and security.
entry.title: Deprecated: Composer versions reaching end of support

entry.content: Cloud Composer 3 environments no longer consume the Cloud SQL Admin API quota in the customer project.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 3 environments have been updated to no longer consume the Cloud SQL Admin API quota within your project. This change aims to improve resource management and prevent potential quota limitations for your Cloud SQL instances.
entry.title: Change: Composer 3: No longer uses Cloud SQL Admin API quota

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.7
  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.24 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.44
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3. This includes updates to Airflow 3.1.0, 2.10.5, and 2.9.3. The default build is now Airflow 2.10.5.
entry.title: Change: New Airflow builds available

entry.content: Improved error handling when an invalid Airflow version is specified during environment creation.
entry.summary: We've enhanced error handling for environment creation when an invalid Airflow version is provided. This update ensures a clearer and more informative experience for users encountering version-related issues.
entry.title: Fixed: Improved Airflow version error handling

entry.content: (Airflow 3.1.0 in Cloud Composer 3) The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package was upgraded to version 10.11.1. For changes in other packages, see the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.summary: The cncf-kubernetes provider for Airflow has been upgraded to version 10.11.1. For a full list of changes, please refer to the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.title: Change: Airflow Provider Updated

entry.content:
Environments with Cloud Composer 2 versions 2.16.0 and 2.16.1 might experience a known issue with the reporting of metrics. You can observe a few skipped data points in the reported metrics and see error messages about the airflow-monitoring pod restarts in the environment logs.

This issue doesn't affect the environment's functionality. The environment is still operational and the environment health and monitoring information is reported correctly. You can ignore the error messages.
entry.summary: Users of Composer 2 versions 2.16.0 and 2.16.1 may observe skipped metrics data points and related error messages. This known issue does not impact environment functionality, and the environment remains operational with correct health and monitoring information. The error messages can be safely ignored.
entry.title: Issue: Composer 2 Metric Reporting Issue

entry.content:
Extra Large environments are now generally available (GA) in Cloud Composer 3:

  • You can now use the extra large environment size for new and existing Cloud Composer 3 environments.
  • The new Extra Large environment preset is available in the Google Cloud console. This preset sets the initial scale and performance configuration for an environment that can support up to several thousand DAGs. For more information about the estimated number of supported DAGs, DAG runs, and tasks, see Environment presets.
entry.summary: Extra Large environments for Cloud Composer 3 are now generally available, allowing you to support thousands of DAGs. This new preset is accessible in the Google Cloud console for both new and existing environments.
entry.title: Feature: Extra Large Environments Now Available

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.11, composer-2.10.1-*.
entry.summary: Certain versions of Cloud Composer, including composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.11 and composer-2.10.1-\* builds, have reached their end of support period. Users are encouraged to migrate to supported versions to ensure continued service availability.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer versions reaching end of support

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.6
  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.23 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.43
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including updates for Airflow 3.1.0, 2.10.5, and 2.9.3. These builds offer the latest features and improvements for your data pipelines.
entry.title: Change: New Airflow builds available

entry.content: Fixed an issue where the Copy button on the DAG details page in the Airflow UI was copying incorrect content.
entry.summary: The copy button on the DAG details page in the Airflow UI has been fixed. This resolves an issue where it was previously copying incorrect content.
entry.title: Fixed: Airflow UI copy button fixed

entry.content: (Airflow 3.1.0 in Cloud Composer 3) The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package was upgraded to version 10.11.0. For changes in other packages, see the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package has been upgraded to version 10.11.0 in Cloud Composer 3. For a full list of changes, please refer to the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.title: Change: Airflow 3.1.0 available in Composer

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.16.1-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.16.1-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 are now available, including the default composer-2.16.1-airflow-2.10.5 version. These updates provide the latest Airflow versions for your environments.
entry.title: Change: New Composer Image Available

entry.content:
Database retention policy is now available in environments with Airflow 3, starting with composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.5.

This change is gradually rolled out in several releases and is available in the following regions in this release: africa-south1, asia-east1, asia-northeast2, asia-northeast3, asia-south2, asia-southeast2, asia-southeast3, australia-southeast2, europe-central2, europe-north2, europe-southwest1, europe-west10, europe-west12, europe-west15, europe-west4, europe-west6, europe-west8, europe-west9, me-central1, me-central2, me-west1, northamerica-northeast1, northamerica-northeast2, northamerica-south1, southamerica-east1, southamerica-west1, us-east5, us-south1, us-west3, us-west4.
entry.summary: The database retention policy feature is now available for environments running Airflow 3, starting with composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.5. This feature provides enhanced control over database management within your environments and is rolling out across multiple regions.
entry.title: Feature: Database retention policy available

entry.content:
(Airflow 3.1.0 in Cloud Composer 3) The apache-airflow-providers-google package was upgraded to version 19.1.0.

For more information about changes, see the apache-airflow-providers-google changelog.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-google package has been upgraded to version 19.1.0 in Cloud Composer 3. This update includes various changes and improvements to the Google provider package. For a detailed list of modifications, please refer to the official Airflow documentation.
entry.title: Change: Airflow Providers Google Updated

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 2) Cloud Composer's high availability infrastructure was enhanced to provide greater resilience against zonal outages. This feature was announced previously and has finished gradually rolling out to all regions supported by Cloud Composer.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer's high availability infrastructure has been improved to offer better resilience against zonal outages. This feature is now available in all supported regions.
entry.title: Feature: Enhanced composer infrastructure for resilience

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 3) The name format for network attachments created by Cloud Composer was modified to enhance uniqueness. This change applies only to newly created network attachments.
entry.summary: The naming format for network attachments in Cloud Composer 3 has been updated to improve uniqueness. This change affects only newly created network attachments and ensures better identification within your network configurations.
entry.title: Change: New network attachment naming for Cloud Composer 3

entry.content: (Airflow 3.1.0 and 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package was upgraded to version 10.9.0. For changes in other packages, see the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.summary: The Kubernetes provider package for Airflow has been upgraded to version 10.9.0. This update includes changes specific to the Kubernetes provider. For details on updates in other packages, please refer to the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.title: Change: Kubernetes provider for Airflow updated

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.5
  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.22 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.42
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including options for Airflow 3.1.0, 2.10.5 (default), and 2.9.3. These updates provide the latest features and improvements for your data pipelines.
entry.title: Change: New Airflow Builds Available

entry.content: Fixed an issue where composer.googleapis.com/environment/executor/open_slots and composer.googleapis.com/environment/executor/running_tasks were not available in environments with Airflow 3.
entry.summary: The executor metrics `open_slots` and `running_tasks` are now available for environments running Airflow 3. This issue prevented users from accessing these crucial metrics, impacting monitoring capabilities.
entry.title: Fixed: Executor metrics fixed for Airflow 3

entry.content:
(Airflow 3.1.0 and 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-google package was upgraded to version 19.0.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

For more information about changes, see the apache-airflow-providers-google changelog from version 18.0.0 to version 19.0.0.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-google package has been upgraded to version 19.0.0 in Cloud Composer. This update is available for both Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds. More details can be found in the Airflow provider changelog.
entry.title: Change: Updated Google Provider for Airflow

entry.content: Database retention policy is now available in environments with Airflow 3, starting with composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.5. This change is gradually rolled out in several releases and is available in the following regions in this release: europe-north1, us-west2, us-east1, europe-west3, asia-east2.
entry.summary: The database retention policy feature is now available for environments using Airflow 3, starting with composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.5. This feature is gradually rolling out and is currently available in select regions including europe-north1, us-west2, us-east1, europe-west3, and asia-east2.
entry.title: Feature: Database retention policy now available

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.16.0-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.16.0-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 have been released, including composer-2.16.0-airflow-2.10.5 as the default. This update brings the latest improvements and features to your Airflow environments.
entry.title: Change: New Cloud Composer Images Available

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.22, composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.23, composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.2, composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.3, composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.4, composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.5, composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.6, composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.7, composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.10, composer-2.9.10-*, composer-2.9.11-*, composer-2.10.0-*.
entry.summary: Several Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period. Please upgrade to a supported version to ensure continued access to security updates and features.
entry.title: Deprecated: Composer versions end of support

entry.content: The dates for maintenance exclusions were changed from the dates announced earlier. All Cloud Composer environment's GKE clusters are now set up with maintenance exclusions from December 4, 2025 to January 2, 2026. For more information, see Maintenance exclusions.
entry.summary: The maintenance exclusion dates for Cloud Composer environments have been updated. All GKE clusters will now have maintenance exclusions from December 4, 2025, to January 2, 2026.
entry.title: Announcement: Maintenance Exclusions Updated

entry.content:
We discovered an issue that might impact the reporting of metrics in the following recently released Cloud Composer versions:

  • composer-2.15.4-airflow-*
  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.20
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.40
  • composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.3

To prevent additional environments from being affected, we have disabled the ability to upgrade existing environments to these versions and to create new environments using these versions. If your environment is already using one of these versions, you can continue to use it as usual. We are working to resolve the issue for all currently affected environments.
entry.summary: We found an issue that may affect metrics reporting in specific recent Cloud Composer versions. To prevent further impact, we've blocked upgrades and new deployments of these versions. Affected environments can still be used, and we're working on a fix.
entry.title: Issue: Issue with reporting metrics in Cloud Composer

entry.content: All Cloud Composer environment's GKE clusters are set up with maintenance exclusions from December 16, 2025 to January 2, 2026. For more information, see Maintenance exclusions.
entry.summary: All Cloud Composer environments will have maintenance exclusions applied to their GKE clusters from December 16, 2025, to January 2, 2026. This is to ensure service continuity during the holiday period. For detailed information, please refer to the documentation on maintenance exclusions.
entry.title: Announcement: Composer maintenance period

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.2
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including composer-3-airflow-3.1.0-build.2.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds available

entry.content: You can now start Gemini Cloud Assist investigations for failed Airflow tasks.
entry.summary: Investigate failed Airflow tasks with Gemini Cloud Assist.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Cloud Assist Investigations for Airflow

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.19 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.39
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.19 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.39.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds available for Cloud Composer 3

entry.content:
Fixed the CVE-2025-49844 vulnerability. The updated version of the environment component that hosts a Redis-based task queue is available:

  • To apply the fix in Cloud Composer 3, upgrade the Airflow build of your environment to airflow-2.10.5-build.19 or airflow-2.9.3-build.39, or later.
  • To apply the fix in Cloud Composer 2, upgrade your environment to Cloud Composer version 2.15.3, or later.
entry.summary: Resolved CVE-2025-49844 vulnerability. Update your environment to the latest version to apply the security patch.
entry.title: Security: Security Update

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.15.3-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.15.3-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.15.3-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.15.3-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New images available for Cloud Composer 2

entry.content: Resolved an issue in the Kubernetes Pod Operator (KPO) where the Kubernetes client experienced unreliable connections, leading to occasional failures. The fix enhances connection stability through the addition of retry logic for underlying connectivity problems.
entry.summary: Resolved an issue in the Kubernetes Pod Operator (KPO) where the Kubernetes client experienced unreliable connections, leading to occasional failures. The fix enhances connection stability through the addition of retry logic for underlying connectivity problems.
entry.title: Fixed: Kubernetes Pod Operator connection stability improved

entry.content: We strongly recommend to use highly resilient environments for production use cases. Highly resilient environments provide high availability and use built-in redundancy and failover mechanisms to reduce the environment's susceptibility to zonal failures and single point of failure outages.
entry.summary: For production use cases, highly resilient environments are recommended. They offer high availability and reduce susceptibility to zonal failures.
entry.title: Announcement: Highly Resilient Environments

entry.content: All Cloud Composer environment's GKE clusters will receive maintenance exclusions from November 8, 2025 to December 2, 2025. For more information, see Maintenance exclusions.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer environments will have GKE cluster maintenance exclusions from November 8 to December 2, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Maintenance Exclusions for Cloud Composer

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.18 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.38
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3, including composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.18 (default) and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.38.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds available

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.21 and composer-2.9.9-*.
entry.summary: Certain Cloud Composer versions are no longer supported. This includes composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.21 and composer-2.9.9-*. More details can be found in the versioning overview.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer versions deprecated

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.15.2-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.15.2-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.15.2-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.15.2-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New Images Available

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 3) Airflow workers are restarted when they exceed their storage limit.
entry.summary: Airflow workers will now restart automatically when they exceed their storage limit, ensuring uninterrupted operation.
entry.title: Fixed: Airflow workers restart on exceeding storage limit

entry.content: Fixed an error where Airflow components failed to start up when multiple objects with the same name were present in the /dags or /plugins folder in the environment's bucket.
entry.summary: Resolved an issue that prevented Airflow components from starting when duplicate object names existed in `/dags` or `/plugins` folders.
entry.title: Fixed: Airflow startup error fixed

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.15.1-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.15.1-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.15.1-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.15.1-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New images available for Cloud Composer 2

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 2) Configuration of firewall rules for Private IP environments now requires allowing egress traffic on port 19090.
entry.summary: Configuration of firewall rules for Private IP environments now requires allowing egress traffic on port 19090.
entry.title: Fixed: Firewall rules updated

entry.content: The default value of the NO_PROXY environment variable now includes the IP address of the environment's cluster Compute Engine metadata server.
entry.summary: The NO_PROXY environment variable now includes the IP address of the environment's cluster Compute Engine metadata server.
entry.title: Changed: Updated NO_PROXY environment variable

entry.content: (Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package was upgraded to version 10.8.2. For changes in other packages, see the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package has been upgraded to version 10.8.2.
entry.title: Changed: Airflow Kubernetes provider upgraded

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.17 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.37
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.17 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.37.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds available

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.20, composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.19, composer-2.9.8-*, composer-2.9.7-*.

(Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-google package was upgraded to version 18.0.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

For more information about changes, see the apache-airflow-providers-google changelog from version 17.2.0 to version 18.0.0.

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 2 versions from 2.12.0 to 2.12.3) Fixed a problem where Airflow components in the environment's cluster were running out of ephemeral storage. This change rolls out gradually over several releases to all regions supported by Cloud Composer 2.
entry.summary: A storage issue affecting Airflow components in Cloud Composer 2 environments has been resolved. This fix addresses problems where components ran out of ephemeral storage.
entry.title: Fixed: Ephemeral storage issue fixed in Cloud Composer 2

New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.16 (default)

entry.content: Upgrade checks are now generally available (GA) in Cloud Composer 3 and Cloud Composer 2.
entry.summary: Upgrade checks are now generally available for Cloud Composer 3 and 2.
entry.title: Feature: Upgrade Checks Now GA

entry.content: The GCE_METADATA_TIMEOUT environment variable is changed to reserved. This change addresses an issue where setting a low timeout value disrupted the environment's operations that relied on the metadata server.
entry.summary: The GCE_METADATA_TIMEOUT environment variable has been changed to reserved. This resolves an issue where a low timeout value could disrupt operations reliant on the metadata server.
entry.title: Fixed: Metadata server timeout is now reserved

entry.content: DAG UI now correctly generates error messages about malformed serialized DAG.
entry.summary: The DAG UI has been updated to correctly generate error messages when encountering malformed serialized DAGs.
entry.title: Fixed: Malformed DAGs now show errors

entry.content:
(Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-google package was upgraded to version 17.2.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

For more information about changes, see the apache-airflow-providers-google changelog from version 17.1.0 to version 17.2.0.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-google package has been upgraded to version 17.2.0.
entry.title: Changed: Airflow package upgraded

entry.content: (Airflow 2.10.5) CloudComposerDAGRunSensor is broken in the apache-airflow-providers-google package version 17.2.0. This package is used by Cloud Composer versions and builds with Airflow 2.10.5 available in this release. If your DAGs use this sensor, we recommend you postpone upgrading until the issue is resolved.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 2.10.5 users: CloudComposerDAGRunSensor in apache-airflow-providers-google v17.2.0 is broken. Please postpone upgrades if your DAGs use this sensor.
entry.title: Issue: Cloud Composer Issue

entry.content: Fixed an issue where values of Airflow configuration options were evaluated before being set. As a result, the actual value was set to the evaluated result.
entry.summary: An issue where Airflow configuration option values were evaluated before being set has been resolved. The configuration options will now be set to their correct values.
entry.title: Fixed: Configuration options evaluation fixed

entry.content: Fixed Airflow logs not exporting to Cloud Logging because of a GKE version mismatch between Airflow worker and GKE Control plane nodes.
entry.summary: The issue preventing Airflow logs from exporting to Cloud Logging has been resolved. This was caused by a GKE version mismatch between Airflow worker and GKE Control plane nodes.
entry.title: Fixed: Airflow logs export fixed

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 2) Cloud Composer's high availability infrastructure was enhanced to provide greater resilience against zonal outages. This change rolls out gradually over several releases to all regions supported by Cloud Composer 2.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 2 now offers enhanced high availability infrastructure to better withstand zonal outages. This improvement is being rolled out across all supported regions.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Composer 2 High Availability

entry.content: (Available without upgrading) Cloud Composer 3 now supports DNS resolution for regional service endpoints. You can now reach regional service endpoints from DAGs in your environment. This change is available in Public IP environments without additional configuration. For Private IP environments, an environment must be connected to a VPC network where private endpoints are configured.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now supports DNS resolution for regional service endpoints, allowing you to reach them from your DAGs. This feature is available in Public IP environments without extra configuration and in Private IP environments when connected to a VPC network with private endpoints configured.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Composer 3 Now Supports DNS Resolution for Regional Service Endpoints

entry.content: You can now check if a Cloud Composer 2 environment's configuration is compatible with Cloud Composer 3. We recommend doing this check before migrating to Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: Check your Cloud Composer 2 environment's configuration for compatibility with Cloud Composer 3 before upgrading.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Composer 3 Upgrade Compatibility Check

entry.content:
Improved the startup times of Airflow workers for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed.

This feature was announced previously and has finished gradually rolling out to all regions supported by Cloud Composer.

entry.title: Feature: Faster Airflow Worker Startups

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 2) Moved the update_fab_perms option from [webserver] to [fab] in the Airflow configuration. The corresponding deprecation warning is no longer generated in Airflow web server logs.
entry.summary: The `update_fab_perms` option has been moved from the `[webserver]` section to the `[fab]` section in the Airflow configuration for Cloud Composer 2. This change eliminates the deprecation warning previously seen in Airflow web server logs.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 2: FAB Permissions Update

entry.content:
(Airflow 2.10.5 only) Added task-level resource consumption Airflow metrics to Cloud Composer.

  • composer.googleapis.com/workflow/task/cpu_usage: percentage of CPU used by a task.
  • composer.googleapis.com/workflow/task/cpu_usage: percentage of memory used by a task.
entry.summary: New metrics for task CPU and memory usage are now available in Cloud Composer.
entry.title: Feature: Task-level resource consumption metrics

entry.summary: The web server restarting feature for Cloud Composer 2 and 3 is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Web Server Restarting Now GA

entry.content:
If your environment uses dag-factory package version 0.22, then you might experience DAG failures in Cloud Composer versions that have apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package version 10.4.2 or later. At the same time, upgrading the dag-factory package to version 0.23 might require you to update your DAG code to make it compatible.

If your environment uses dag-factory version 0.22, we recommend to do the following:

  • Temporarily postpone upgrading your environment until you're ready to switch to dag-factory version 0.23. Last versions of Cloud Composer that support version 0.22 are composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.3, composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.23, composer-2.13.1-airflow-2.10.5, and composer-2.13.1-airflow-2.9.3 released on May 14, 2025.
  • When you are ready to upgrade, update your DAGs for compatibility with 0.23. We recommend to do this in a development environment first. Install dag-factory version 0.23, then check that your DAGs are parsed and are working correctly, and update them if needed. After your DAGs are compatible, install dag-factory version 0.23 in your production environment and transfer the updated DAGs. Your environment can now be upgraded to a later version of Cloud Composer or Airflow.
  • If your environment is already upgraded to a later version of Cloud Composer and you experience problems, then update dag-factory to version 0.23 and update your DAGs for compatibility with 0.23.
entry.summary: This announcement provides guidance on potential DAG failures in Cloud Composer when using dag-factory version 0.22 with specific Airflow provider versions. It recommends postponing upgrades or updating to dag-factory version 0.23 with necessary DAG code modifications.
entry.title: Announcement: DAG Failures with dag-factory v0.22

entry.content: Highly resilient environments are now generally available (GA) in Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now offers generally available highly resilient environments, enhancing the reliability of your workloads.
entry.title: Feature: Highly Resilient Environments Now Available in Cloud Composer 3

entry.content:
We're changing the way we provide support dates for Airflow builds in Cloud Composer 3. Before this change, some Airflow builds had their end of support date listed as "To be announced" until a later Airflow version became available. We're deprecating this approach for all builds that are released after July 01, 2025.

We are now providing support dates that depend on a date when a particular Airflow build was released:

  • We are introducing the standard support period of 12 months after the release date.
  • All Airflow builds that didn't have an end of support date when this change was introduced are supported until July 1, 2026. Because of this change, some Airflow builds released before July 1, 2025 are supported for longer than the standard support period.
  • All Airflow builds that had their support date shorter than 12 months are now supported for 12 months since the date of their initial release.
  • All builds released after July 1, 2025 will use the standard support period.
entry.summary: We are updating the support dates for Airflow builds in Cloud Composer 3. Starting July 1, 2025, all new builds will have a 12-month standard support period from their release date. Existing builds without a defined end of support date will now be supported until July 1, 2026, with some receiving extended support beyond the standard period.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 3: Updated Airflow Support Dates

entry.content: A new Cloud Composer release has started on July 9, 2025. Get ready for upcoming changes and features as we roll out the new release to all regions. This release is in progress at the moment. Listed changes and features might not be available in some regions yet.
entry.summary: A new Cloud Composer release began on July 9, 2025, and is currently being rolled out to all regions. This release includes new features and changes that may not be available in all regions yet.
entry.title: Announcement: New Cloud Composer Release

entry.content:
We are gradually rolling out a change that switches the default version from Cloud Composer 2 to Cloud Composer 3 in the Cloud Composer API.

In regions where the change is rolled out, a Cloud Composer 3 environment is created by default when a version is not specified in Google Cloud CLI, Cloud Composer API, or Terraform. If you use automation scripts to provision Cloud Composer 2 environments, make sure that you explicitly specify a Cloud Composer 2 version.

In this release, the change is rolling out in the following regions: africa-south1, asia-northeast2, asia-south2, asia-southeast2, europe-southwest1, europe-west10, europe-west12, europe-west8, me-central1, me-central2, me-west1, southamerica-west1, and us-south1.
entry.summary: The Cloud Composer API's default environment version is being updated from Cloud Composer 2 to Cloud Composer 3. This change will affect new environments created without a specified version in certain regions. Users relying on Cloud Composer 2 should explicitly select that version in their automation scripts.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 3 becomes default

entry.content: (Available without upgrading) During Cloud Composer 2 environment operations, a more informative error message is returned when an environment's web server has connectivity issues.
entry.summary: A more informative error message is now returned for Cloud Composer 2 environments when the web server experiences connectivity issues.
entry.title: Changed: Improved error message for Composer 2 web server connectivity

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.29
entry.summary: New builds for Airflow 2.10.5 and 2.9.3 are now available for Cloud Composer 3.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3

entry.content: Cloud Composer versions 2.8.4 and 2.8.5 have reached their end of support period.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer versions 2.8.4 and 2.8.5 are no longer supported. Please upgrade to a newer version to continue receiving support.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer versions 2.8.4 and 2.8.5 deprecated

entry.content:
Cloud Composer 1 and Cloud Composer 2 environments with version 2.0.x are approaching their end of life. We're planning to deprecate them in the following way:

  • Starting September 15, 2025, you will no longer be able to create new Cloud Composer 1 environments.
  • On September 15, 2026, all Cloud Composer 1 and Cloud Composer 2 version 2.0.x environments will reach their planned end of life, and you won't be able to use them.

Cloud Composer 2 environments with versions later than 2.1.0 and all Cloud Composer 3 environments are not affected by this deprecation.

We recommend planning migration to Cloud Composer 3 or upgrading your Cloud Composer 2 environments to a later version.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 1 and version 2.0.x of Cloud Composer 2 are nearing their end of life. You won't be able to create new Cloud Composer 1 environments after September 15, 2025. All Cloud Composer 1 and Cloud Composer 2 version 2.0.x environments will be unusable after September 15, 2026. Please migrate to Cloud Composer 3 or upgrade your existing environments.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 1 and 2 version 2.0.x end of life

entry.content: A new Cloud Composer release has started on July 1, 2025. This release is in progress at the moment. Listed changes might not be available in some regions yet.
entry.summary: A new Cloud Composer release began on July 1, 2025, and is currently in progress. Please note that some changes may not be available in all regions yet.
entry.title: Announcement: Cloud Composer Release Update

entry.content: This release includes internal infrastructure improvements to Cloud Composer. There are no user-visible changes.
entry.summary: This release includes internal infrastructure improvements to Cloud Composer, with no user-facing changes.
entry.title: Changed: Internal improvements to Cloud Composer

entry.content:
Improved the startup times of Airflow workers for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed.

This feature was announced previously and is gradually rolling out over several releases. In this release, it's available in asia-east2, asia-northeast3, europe-central2, europe-west9, me-central1, me-west1, northamerica-northeast1, northamerica-northeast2, northamerica-south1, and us-west1 re
entry.summary: Startup times for Airflow workers with many custom PyPI packages have been improved. This feature is available in several regions, including asia-east2, europe-central2, and us-west1.
entry.title: Feature: Faster Airflow worker startup

entry.content: (Available without upgrading) Fixed an issue where deleting a Cloud Composer 2 environment could fail when the environment's cluster was in the process of creating a node pool.
entry.summary: Deleting a Cloud Composer 2 environment that was creating a node pool no longer fails.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed environment deletion issue

entry.content:
We're planning to phase out the APIs that aren't required by Cloud Composer 3.

  • Starting February 27, 2026, the following APIs will become fully detachable. Deactivating these APIs won't cause the deactivation of the Cloud Composer API:

  • artifactregistry.googleapis.com

  • cloudbuild.googleapis.com
  • container.googleapis.com
  • pubsub.googleapis.com
  • sqladmin.googleapis.com
  • Starting May 27, 2026, these APIs will no longer be enabled automatically when you enable the Cloud Composer API. To create Cloud Composer 2 environments in new projects, the group of detached APIs must be enabled manually.

Existing Cloud Composer 3 and Cloud Composer 2 environments in projects where the Cloud Composer API is already enabled will not be impacted. You can do the following:

  • After February 27, 2026, if your project has only Cloud Composer 3 environments, then you can manually disable the detached APIs.
  • After February 27, 2026, if your project has Cloud Composer 2 environments, then we recommend keeping these APIs enabled because disabling them might lead to environment's malfunction.
  • After May 27, 2026, if you use automation scripts to provision Cloud Composer 2 environments, then make sure that the listed APIs are enabled in addition to the Cloud Composer API.
entry.summary: APIs not required by Cloud Composer 3 will be phased out starting February 27, 2026. Some APIs will become detachable, and after May 27, 2026, they will no longer be automatically enabled with the Cloud Composer API. Existing environments are not impacted, but users should adjust automation scripts and consider the impact on Cloud Composer 2 environments.
entry.title: Announcement: API Sunset for Cloud Composer 3

entry.content: Cloud Composer pages in the Cloud Console now support the dark color theme. You can switch to the dark theme on the Appearance page in the Cloud Console.
entry.summary: The Cloud Console
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Composer now supports dark theme

entry.content: A new Cloud Composer release has started on June 10, 2025. Get ready for upcoming changes and features as we roll out the new release to all regions. This release is in progress at the moment. Listed changes and features might not be available in some regions yet.
entry.summary: A new version of Cloud Composer is being rolled out starting June 10, 2025, bringing new features and changes. The release is currently in progress and features may not be available in all regions yet.
entry.title: Announcement: Cloud Composer Release Update

entry.content: Fixed an issue that caused Airflow worker and scheduler Pods to be evicted when a large number of tasks was executed.
entry.summary: An issue causing Airflow worker and scheduler Pods to be evicted during high task execution volumes has been resolved.
entry.title: Fixed: Resolved Airflow Pod Eviction Issue

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.6 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.26
entry.summary: New builds for Airflow 2.10.5 and 2.9.3 are now available for Cloud Composer 3.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds for Composer 3

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.13.4-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.13.4-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.13.4-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.13.4-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New Composer 2 Images Available

entry.content: Cloud Composer version 2.8.2 has reached its end of support period.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer version 2.8.2 is no longer supported. This version has reached its end of support period. For more information, please refer to the versioning overview.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer 2.8.2 Deprecated

entry.content:
Improved the startup times of Airflow workers for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed.

This change rolls out gradually. In this release, it's available in asia-east1, asia-northeast2, asia-south1, europe-north1, europe-west3, us-east1, us-south1, and us-west2 regions.
entry.summary: We have improved the startup times of Airflow workers, especially for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed. This enhancement is currently available in asia-east1, asia-northeast2, asia-south1, europe-north1, europe-west3, us-east1, us-south1, and us-west2 regions.
entry.title: Feature: Faster Airflow worker startup times

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 3) If a VPC network is attached to an environment, then all DNS addresses accessed by the Airflow components of the environment are resolved using the Cloud DNS configuration of the VPC network. In particular, Airflow workers that execute DAGs will resolve DNS addresses in this way.
entry.summary: With Cloud Composer 3, Airflow components in an environment will now use the VPC network's Cloud DNS configuration for all DNS address resolutions. This change affects Airflow workers executing DAGs, ensuring consistent DNS resolution within the VPC network.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 3: VPC Network DNS Resolution

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 3) All newly created private DNS zones are immediately visible to a Cloud Composer environment. Previously, re-attaching a VPC network was required.
entry.summary: Private DNS zones are now immediately visible to Cloud Composer environments, eliminating the need to re-attach a VPC network.
entry.title: Changed: Immediate visibility for private DNS zones

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 3) It's now possible to use zones with cross-project binding. Before this change, cross-project bound zones weren't supported in Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now supports cross-project bound zones, which were previously not compatible.
entry.title: Fixed: Cloud Composer 3: Cross-project bound zones now supported

entry.content:
(Cloud Composer 2) In Cloud Composer versions 2.11.5 and later, log processing is switching to using OpenTelemetry instead of Fluentd.

This change was announced previously and is gradually rolling out over several releases. In this release, it's available in the following regions: asia-east1, asia-east2, asia-northeast2, asia-northeast3, asia-south2, asia-southeast2, australia-southeast1, australia-southeast2, europe-central2, europe-north1, europe-north2, europe-southwest1, europe-west, europe-west10, europe-west12, europe-west6, europe-west8, europe-west9, me-central1, me-central2, me-west1, northamerica-northeast2, northamerica-south1, southamerica-east1, southamerica-west1, us-east5, us-south1, us-west, and us-west3.
entry.summary: Log processing in Cloud Composer has been updated to use OpenTelemetry instead of Fluentd, starting with version 2.11.5. This change is being rolled out gradually across several releases and is now available in specific regions.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 2: Log Processing Update

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.5 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.25
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.5 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.25.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.13.3-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.13.3-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.13.3-airflow-2.10.5 and composer-2.13.3-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New Cloud Composer 2 Images Available

entry.content: Cloud Composer version 2.8.1 has reached its end of support period.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer version 2.8.1 is no longer supported. This version has reached the end of its support period, and users are encouraged to upgrade to a newer, supported version to ensure continued access to updates and security patches.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer 2.8.1 Deprecated

entry.content: The Composer Local Development CLI tool is now available in Cloud Composer 3. This tool helps to streamline testing and developing by providing local Airflow environments based on Airflow builds used by Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: Test and develop Composer 3 workflows faster with the new local development CLI tool. This feature provides local Airflow environments that mirror the builds used by Cloud Composer 3, simplifying your development process.
entry.title: Feature: New Local Development CLI for Composer 3
